body.p:
Falmouth Ky
Apugst 12 1865
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette
Govr of Ky

Enclosed is a Petition of I. S McGill asking to be relieved from a fine. I would state that I am personally acquainted with said ^McGill^ Know him to be a very poor man with a large family, and believe that in his case it would be write to relieve him from the fine. He has a son Just returned from the army who belonged to the 18th Ky who will have to pay the fine, if not remitted, and I am certain that the offence committed by said McGill will not be repeated.

very Respectfully
Your obt Servt
M Mullins
